text: Im having the same issue right now! Please let me know if you make it anywhere with it
i know this - HubSpot provides an ssl for the www. subdomain since that is where they host the site. but the apex domain is still managed by your DNS provider
Sure will let you know if i find the solution.

<@USF19AKUY> is correct, HubSpot's SSL cert doesn't, can't, cover the apex domain. Further more, you can cant forward secure secure requests to non-secure destinations, meaning you can't forward an https request for your apex domain to the http version of the www domain. The only solution is to separately secure your root domain and forward traffic, securely, to the www domain. <http://Easyredir.com|Easyredir.com> is the easiest solution I've found for this - but others probably exist.
<@UM5JQ5EUE> if i were to configure GoDaddy to secure the apex domainâ€¦ would that solve this issue? (godaddy is the current dns for my site)
could i then go to `<https://mysite.com>` and have it redirect to `<https://www.mysite.com>` safely and securely?
Yes, that should work - anything that applies an SSL cert to the root, can then forward to the https www domain.
